Chess game using chess notation! So play would go like this:

W1: Pawn to D4

B1: Knight to C6

And so on.

I'll take 4 people on a team at a time, each taking turns (players play like this White 1, Black 1, White 2, Black 2, and so on.)

If you leave your team, please tell me.

White team:

1. Mr. Pseudonym

Once we have players, we shall begin!

Edited July 9, 2013 by Mr. Pseudonym
Add players.
No replies? I thought you guys might have wanted to play chess

How about this:

We have a (long term) correspondent's chess game instead. People suggest moves for white. Every few days or so, you (Mr. Pseudonym), as white, will pick a move from suggested moves from the past few days. Every time you move, have a computer play as black for 1 turn, then ask for more white moves.

Provide a picture of the current state of the board, and have a move history included with chess notation.

Suggestions could be formatted like this:

Move suggestion: e4

Or something like that.

Alright holo.

bigyihsuan, that's not what I wanted to create.

Well, it seems easier to manage, as you can't guarantee that everyone on your team is going to be on the forums when it's their move.

My version is essentially Forums vs. Random A.I.
